comment: Ana is an amazing teacher and leaves no student behind. She remains after class for help, she reopens homework if you were unable to complete it, and is an amazing lecturer. The not only teaches what is to be done, but explains why and for what purpose.

I honestly don't understand why someone would give her below a 4 for discrete. She was a great teacher and applied complex topics to real life examples to make it easier. The only reason I didn't get an A was because I rarely studied. Other than that I feel like her lectures and homework helped me excel. Confusing topics were made engaging fs.
Dr. Ana is a fantastic discrete math professor. She gave us a study guide for the final and was easily reachable outside of class. Please do the homework and come to class to pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Does a very good job of creating and posting notes online

So basically shes an extremely tough grader, she says 80% of the HW is graded for participation but that's literally just a lie. 1 of her "office hours" is just a open math lab so she can be held up by students that arnt even hers. She also claims to "not believe in study guides" so do with this information what you will.

She is the best professor to take if you are not good at math. She goes through problems very clearly and gives you time to ask questions. She does give out group activities and quizzes but those are for you to practice and they don't affect your grade. Overall a pretty easy professor for calc 1.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Easily one of my favorite prof at KSU. She gets to know you very blunt but funny. She is very accessible outside of class. I did my accommodations halfway through the year and when SDS couldn't make a slot for me for a test she took time out of her day to proctor it herself. The mock exams and study guide actually help. She gives good feed back too
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed her Calc 1 class. She lectures based on notes that she uploads to D2L and does a good job of answering questions. There is homework due every week and she requires you to make a study guide and a mock exam with answers before every exam. Office hours and SI sessions are encouraged weekly. Very friendly, would take again.

Don't look at a 4/5 rating. This class and the teacher are both equally terrible. She is a harsh grader and barely offers extra credit, but they won't help your grade. I would not recommend this teacher AT ALL. CHOOSE ANOTHER TEACHER OR WAIT UNTIL NEXT SEMESTER if you have to take the class.

Really enjoyed this class. I think she's a pretty fun personality, pretty blunt to dumber questions which isn't a type of humor for everyone but I enjoyed it. I think her notes for the content is really good and helpful in understandign the content. Homework assignments aren't that bad.

She struggles to understand why the students do not have the same level of knowledge as her. She knows the material really well, but teaches too fast. She says she grades the homework off completion and accuracy but its really just accuracy and she grades it HARSH. Doesn't believe in curving tests or extra credit. I would find someone else...

I feel that sometimes she can be demeaning to students who ask dumb questions, but she does always answer questions clearly. Her tests are incredibly easy. She gives points for showing work and doing the right general idea, instead of getting the right answer, so for a Calc 1 class, I would recommend it.

Compared to other math teachers here, she lets you know when we have pop quizzes which is usually every Friday. We have two homework assignments due every week (Mondays and Thursdays). We had three exams aside from the final where you make your own Study Guide for up to 5 bonus points on the exam. She also gives lots of partial points.

she is very nice, but she wasn't my style of teacher. you have to make your study guide, homework is super hard and you only get 5 attempts per question.USE PAST TESTS AND QUIZZES TO STUDY. seriously, don't use anything else, the tests are just past questions with different numbers. but she wasn't the best teacher for me, but everyone is different.

I LOVED professor Ana! I recommend attending every class you can, as she is very good at explaining concepts. Theirs two homework grades and one quiz per week, which can be a lot. Theirs also 3 exams and a final. She does really care and will work with you through anything.

Best professor I have taken! She genuinely cares for every single one of her students understanding the material. She had all the lectures organized and taught them very well and in depth. She cares for the thoughts/work more on the tests and quizzes than the final answer to make sure you really understand. She also gives great 1-to-1 feedback!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Showing up to class helps, however her annotated notes that she posts are just almost as good as lecture. Weekly quizzes. She doesn't teach useless information. She doesn't test her students on anything she does not teach in class. I am taking her for Linear Algebra now, after just taking her for Calc 3, and she teaches this course just as well.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Is a great teacher and really cares, but make sure you do the homeworks.

Hands down one of the best professors I've had. She really cares about her students, and even though it's pretty homework heavy, she offers a few opportunities for extra credit/remediation at the end of the year. There's a quiz once a week. Though you can't make it up if you miss a day, she drops two of the quizzes so it's not too bad. Good choice

Def doesn't deserve any of the hate given to her on here. She is by far one of my fav professors of all! Her caring shows through in how she designs her tests & lectures and is genuinely so sweet. A lot of homework, yes, but no more than any other math class I've taken here, and tests are open note. She has my entire heart & soul, please take her!

Ana is a good professor and cares about her students. She has 2 quizzes per week which is ridiculous. HW once per week, but 30-60 questions long (you'll need all week). Tests are fair, but calc 3 is hard, so they're not easy. I'm the type of student that prefers learning solo apposed to class. If you're like me, I wouldn't recommend this professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Online lectures were the only lectures available for a 100% in person course. Homework on Aleks isn't terrible but it is way tougher when she doesn't teach the material. If you know you won't need math and just need to pass, don't take this. If your major is math heavy and you need to understand this course, also don't take this.
She doesn't teach. She makes us take notes at home and then do busy work in class. I'm learning nothing and her exams are too long for the time given. DO NOT TAKE.

I'm taking her for pre-calculus with a three-day-a-week in-person schedule. She is great at teaching a lecture but gets upset if there isn't enough class participation. For my class, she decided to have all the lectures and notes be taken at home. needless to say, this is not a good way of teaching math as you can't really ask questions.

If you just want an 'Easy A' do not take her. But I loved her classes enough to take her twice in a row (Lin Alg and Calc 3). She has very high expectations of you and you need a good mastery of the material to finish the tests, but they are not impossible to finish (I finished all of them). You have to work hard, but it isn't impossible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I hope you are a math wiz. If not dont take her. Youll will be doing so much hw everyday and it was more rare to finish her test then it was to pass them. Good luck
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Ana has good intentions for her students but thinks every student is going to have a career in linear algebra. Her test questions are insanely hard and she gives too many for a 50-minute class. I'm a math major and she is keeping me up at night. The content is not challenging, she is just not good at presenting and testing our knowledge. Stay Away!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Not as bad as her ratings make her out to be. Math is a demanding subject no matter what. Do the work and you'll be fine. She's a cool professor and shows that she really cares about you as a student.

Calc 4 was a difficult class, but there is no other prof I would rather take it with! Prof Ana was very kind and funny and did a good job explaining, I always looked forward to her class. Tests were difficult to finish in the time period. There is homework about once a week. Make sure to do lots of practice, and math friends are the best friends!

Rodenberg is a weird prof in general. She wants you to address her as Ana and uses third person to address herself. Long, tedious HW due every week and a problem due after each class. Tests are too long for the time given. she expects you to be on the same level of math she is. Would never take again, hope I never see again. Go with Jeff Berman.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She overcomplicates things, with overly dense/unclear lectures. She did NOT adapt to covid well at all, and lectures were based on slides. Notes were a struggle and problems were hard to follow across multiple slides. Homework due 3 times a week was WILDLY frustrating. Tests are brutally crunched for time. She cared more about rigor than teaching

The overall content of calc 3 is one of the easier calls in my opinion. The only problem is she expects you to be a professional mathematician. You will never have enough time to finish one of her test. She is a good lecturer however. But do yourself the favor and try and find another professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: You will spend more time on her class than any your other classes combined. The content is easy and she is good at explaining but she expects you to be perfect in math. No one in our class has finished one of her exams. Good luck
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Her class was really well organized, and I really appreciated the graded homework where we could get feedback on our work and extra practice. I think making us turn in homework three times a week was a bit much, but other than that, it was fine.

I was surprised when I saw her ratings! I'm not very good at (nor do I like) math but she carried me all the way through. She definitely gave us a lot of homework but it was good homework that taught you the material and ALEKS gives you feedback when you get a question wrong. I wish I had more math teachers like her!

Seems to be very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. A lot of the coursework is learned through the ALEKs program we use for hw. First year teaching at KSU. Good at answering questions/communication. Practice the material and attend the lectures.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: (Prefer 2.5) Dr. Rodenberg gives 'I know best' mom power, with lecturely worksheets, high project expectations, challenging exams, little flexibility, takes input poorly. However, she cares long as you do work, has rare extra credit work, + group chat surprisingly fun. This was my only B of the semester, yet was my most time-demanding class.

She's not the worst professor out there as some people complain, but she's no easy A. Pros: Very good lecturer, good attitude and friendly, does seem to care about students. Cons: Yikes, super tough grader, 3 homework assignments due a week! Her tests aren't easy at all! She can't take criticism so don't bother, its her way or else.

Professor Rodenberg is a great professor! She cares about the subject matter and she cares about her students. Her exam study guides are very helpful. She answers lots of questions and helps you out a lot! As long as you pay attention and study, you will do well in this class.

She checks emails often and is very nice and helpful. Go to office hours and do the homework and you will be fine. The class is harder than it needs to be. She requires lots of writing and explaining to receive credit. Gives out partial credit even if the answer is completely wrong. Don't take her if you are limited time on time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: She's very passionate about the subject she's teaching. Although she makes very many stupid jokes but I can tell that she's trying to make math fun. Tests are very hard but If you study the material you will pass

Ana is a nice person. However, I don't think she is fit to be a professor. You can tell she loves what she does but she is not very good at delivering it. She makes the material seem harder than it is, gives 3 hw per week, does not take criticism at all, gives 45min for 13ques exam, and is VERY picky when it comes to grading it. TAKE SOMEONE ELSE!

Highly recommend. Shes funny and really cares about the material and will go out of her way to help you understand. She comes across as a little condescending sometimes but Ill look the other way because a good math teacher is hard to find. Just show up for class, do the homework, and pay attention to her handouts. Youll do fine!

+: very passionate about math, a solid lecturer, a good personality in class -: tough grader on assignments. Doesnt take criticism/feedback well from students at all. While she is good in lecture, the class is over kill for Linear Algebra I, as some stuff is meant for the LA II course, and thus the class seems like its harder than it has to be
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Ana has a passion for teaching and whenever talking with her, shows that she REALLY knows and loves the subject. However, there were many cases where your answers and hers on exams and homework would match up, but you would miss one small detail and get most or entire points taken off. Feels as if she's making an objective math class subjective.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Doesn't take criticism from her students well at all. Gives her students less time than normal class time for tests (45 minutes instead of 55). Her tests are super difficult and she's very picky when grading them. If you truly love math, then go for it. If you just need to get the class out of the way, you're better off taking someone else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Ana is usually a very nice person, but she does not take well to any type of criticism from students. Her tests are hard, like really hard, especially when compared to tests from other teachers. Almost all of the students in my class felt we weren't given enough time on the exams. She also makes homework due 3 times per week, not a lot of down time
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
